title: Column - Usage Examples (Enhanced)
description: Comprehensive column layout patterns verified against plugin source for responsive width control and content alignment

examples.name: 50% Width Column (Desktop â†’ Full Width Mobile)
examples.description: Half-width column on desktop, full-width on mobile - most common pattern
examples.visualDescription: 50% width on desktop, 50% on tablet, 100% on mobile. Content centered vertically.
examples.useCase: 2-column layouts, split content sections, feature + image combinations
examples.responsiveNotes: Column takes 50% width on desktop/tablet, stacks to full width on mobile
examples.layoutNotes: Parent tp-row should have 2 columns for this to work as 50/50 split

examples.name: 33% Width Column (3-Column Grid)
examples.visualDescription: 33.33% width on desktop, 50% on tablet, 100% on mobile. Perfect for feature grids.
examples.useCase: Service showcases, feature grids, icon box layouts
examples.responsiveNotes: 3 columns on desktop, 2 on tablet, 1 on mobile
examples.layoutNotes: Parent row should have 3 columns. blockSpace adds spacing between blocks inside column.

examples.name: 25% Width Column (4-Column Grid)
examples.visualDescription: 25% width on desktop, 50% on tablet, 100% on mobile. Ideal for team/service grids.
examples.useCase: Team members, service grids, portfolio items, statistics
examples.responsiveNotes: 4 columns on desktop, 2 on tablet, 1 on mobile

examples.name: 70% Main Content Column
examples.description: Wider column for main content in content/sidebar layout
examples.visualDescription: 70% width on desktop for main content, full width on mobile
examples.useCase: Blog layouts, content with sidebar, main content areas
examples.responsiveNotes: Main content column - pair with 30% sidebar column. Stacks vertically on tablet/mobile.
examples.layoutNotes: Use with 30% width column for sidebar. Remove right padding on mobile.

examples.name: 30% Sidebar Column
examples.description: Narrower column for sidebar in content/sidebar layout
examples.visualDescription: 30% width on desktop for sidebar, full width on mobile (appears below main content)
examples.visualTips: Light background and left border visually separates sidebar from main content

examples.name: Sticky Column (Pro)
examples.description: Column that sticks to viewport when scrolling
examples.visualDescription: Column sticks to top when scrolling, with 40px top/bottom offset. Enabled on desktop/tablet only.
examples.useCase: Sticky sidebars, persistent CTAs, sticky navigation
warnings: Sticky columns only work on desktop by default (stickyDes: true)
Disable on mobile (stickyMob: false) to avoid viewport issues
topSpace/botSpace create offset from viewport edge when sticky
Parent row must have sufficient height for sticky effect to activate

validationRules.stickycol: Must be true to enable sticky
validationRules.stickyMob: Usually false - sticky columns problematic on mobile

examples.name: Centered Column with Background
examples.description: Column with background, border, and shadow for card-like appearance
examples.visualDescription: 50% width, white background, light border, subtle shadow. Content centered both horizontally and vertically.
examples.useCase: Feature boxes, testimonial cards, call-out sections
examples.visualTips: Combining background, border, shadow, and borderRadius creates professional card effect

examples.name: Column with Hover Effect
examples.description: Column that changes background and border on hover
examples.visualDescription: White background normally, purple gradient on hover. Border changes from gray to purple on hover.
examples.useCase: Interactive feature boxes, clickable cards, hover effects
examples.visualTips: Smooth transitions create professional hover effect. Consider inverting text colors on hover.

examples.name: Full-Width Single Column
examples.description: 100% width column for full-width content sections
examples.visualDescription: Full width on all devices, centered content with max-width constraint
examples.useCase: Full-width headers, single-column content, centered CTAs
examples.layoutNotes: Single column takes full width of parent row. Content inside can be centered with horizontalPos.

examples.name: Clickable Column with Link
examples.description: Entire column acts as clickable link
examples.visualDescription: 50% width column where entire area is clickable, with hover effect
examples.useCase: Feature boxes that link to pages, clickable cards, CTA sections
warnings: wrapLink: true makes entire column clickable
Provide colUrl with url, target, and nofollow properties
Add hover effects to indicate clickability

Width.description: Column width - responsive values required for proper mobile layout
Width.recommended: Set md, sm, xs for all breakpoints. Typically: md=column%, sm=50%, xs=100%

verticalPos.description: Vertical alignment of content inside column

horizontalPos.description: Horizontal alignment/justify-content of content inside column

blockSpace.description: Spacing between blocks inside column (margin-bottom on all blocks except last)

stickycol.warning: Requires sufficient parent row height to activate

warnings: **CRITICAL**: Never modify or regenerate block_id - causes blocks to break
Column must be child of tp-row block - use proper nesting
Width values should add up to 100% across all columns in a row (accounting for gutterSpace)
Always set responsive Width values (md, sm, xs) for proper mobile layout
Typical responsive pattern: md=column%, sm=50% or 100%, xs=100%
Sticky columns (stickycol) should be disabled on mobile (stickyMob: false)
topSpace/botSpace only apply when stickycol is enabled
wrapLink requires colUrl to be set with url property
blockSpace adds margin-bottom to blocks inside column (except last block)
verticalPos and horizontalPos use flexbox values (flex-start, center, flex-end, etc.)
openBg: 1 is required before setting background properties
openBorder: 1 is required before setting border properties
openShadow: 1 is required before setting shadow properties

commonMistakes.mistake: Not setting responsive Width values for mobile
commonMistakes.fix: Always set Width.xs: '100' for mobile full-width stacking
commonMistakes.impact: Columns don't stack properly on mobile

commonMistakes.fix: Ensure all columns in row add to 100% (e.g., 50% + 50%, or 33.33% + 33.33% + 33.33%)
commonMistakes.impact: Broken layout with columns wrapping incorrectly

commonMistakes.fix: Set stickyMob: false - sticky columns consume too much viewport on mobile
commonMistakes.impact: Poor mobile UX with sticky sidebar taking all space

commonMistakes.fix: Provide colUrl with url, target, nofollow when wrapLink is true
Remember parent row's gutterSpace is added as padding to each column
commonMistakes.impact: Actual column width is less than Width setting due to padding

commonMistakes.mistake: Not using blockSpace for vertical rhythm
commonMistakes.fix: Set blockSpace to create consistent spacing between blocks inside column
commonMistakes.impact: Blocks inside column have no spacing between them

bestPractices: Always set responsive Width for all breakpoints (md, sm, xs)
Common pattern: md=custom%, sm=50% or 100%, xs=100%
Use verticalPos: 'flex-start' for columns with varying heights
Use horizontalPos: 'center' to center content inside column
Set blockSpace for consistent vertical rhythm (20-30px recommended)
Use sticky columns sparingly - only for sidebars or persistent CTAs
Disable sticky on mobile (stickyMob: false) for better UX
Add hover effects (HoverBg, HoverBorder) for interactive columns
Use wrapLink for clickable feature boxes or card layouts
Test column layouts on all breakpoints (desktop, tablet, mobile)

layoutContext.widthBehavior: Width sets column width as percentage or fixed value. Parent row's gutterSpace adds padding.
layoutContext.responsiveStacking: Columns stack when total widths exceed 100% at breakpoint. Typically xs=100 for mobile stacking.
layoutContext.verticalAlignment: verticalPos aligns blocks inside column vertically (flex align-items/align-content)
layoutContext.horizontalAlignment: horizontalPos aligns blocks inside column horizontally (flex justify-content)
layoutContext.blockSpacing: blockSpace adds margin-bottom to all blocks inside column except last
layoutContext.stickyBehavior: Sticky columns stick to viewport when scrolling, with topSpace/botSpace offsets
layoutContext.clickableColumn: wrapLink makes entire column act as link, useful for card layouts

performanceConsiderations: Sticky columns use JavaScript for positioning - can impact scroll performance
Limit sticky columns to 1-2 per page for best performance
Hover effects with Transition create smooth animations - minimal performance impact
Complex backgrounds (gradients, images) in HoverBg can affect hover performance on slower devices
